title: Definition of Correlational Study
text: A correlational study is a type of research design that examines the relationship between two or more variables, without manipulation or influence from the researcher. A correlational study can show an association between two variables in a study.

title: Correlation vs Causation
text: A correlation between two variables is not the same thing as causation.

title: Reflection on Correlational Study
text: Can a correlational study establish a direct cause and effect relationship between variables?
